member.name: T:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.Import
member.summary: This ContainerFragment represent a Media Query, its Selectors SelectorSet should only have a single value (unlike the Selector class which may have multiple Selectors - eg. "div#Header h2, div#Footer"). LESS CSS supports Media Queries that wrap styles and/or other selectors whilst regular CSS only supports the wrapping of selectors in Media Queries.

member.name: T:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ICSSFragment
member.summary: This represents a significant CSS (or LESS) fragment such as selectors (which include media queries as well as CSS selectors) and style property names and values. There will not be any fragments for whitespace or comments, nor break characters such as colons or semicolons.

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ICSSFragment.SourceLineIndex
member.summary: This will always be zero or greater

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.Import.ImportContent
member.summary: This will never be null or blank

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.Import.SourceLineIndex
member.summary: This will always be zero or greater

member.name: T:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment
member.summary: This is a CSS fragment that represents contains other fragments - eg. a Selector or Media Query

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment.Selectors
member.summary: This will never be null, empty nor contain any nulls

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment.ParentSelectors
member.summary: This will never be null nor contain any nulls, it may be empty if this is a top-level Selector

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment.SourceLineIndex
member.summary: This will always be zero or greater

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment.ChildFragments
member.summary: This will never be null nor contain any nulls, it may be empty if there were no child fragments for the Selector

member.name: T:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment.SelectorSet
member.summary: The set will always contain at least one item and none of them will be null references

member.name: M:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment.SelectorSet.GetEnumerator
member.summary: The enumerated data will never be empty nor contain any null references

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.ContainerFragment.WhiteSpaceNormalisedString.Value
member.summary: All whitespace characters will have been replaced with spaces, then any runs of spaces replaced with single instances and finally the string will have been trimmed. This will always have some content and never be null or blank.

member.name: M:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.Misc.SelectorBreaker.Break(System.String)
member.summary: Given a selectors string (eg. "div.formData input[type='hidden'], div.entry p label"), return a set of selectors where each selector is broken into selector segment strings (eg. [ [ "div.formData", "input[type='hidden']" ], [ "div.entry", "p", "label" ] ])

member.name: M:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.Misc.SelectorBreaker.IProcessSelectorContent.Process(System.Char)
member.summary: This will never return null, it will raise an exception if unable to process the content

member.name: M:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.Misc.SelectorBreaker.DefaultSelectorProcessor.Process(System.Char)
member.summary: This will never return null, it will raise an exception if unable to process the content

member.name: M:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.Misc.SelectorBreaker.AttributeSelectorProcessor.Process(System.Char)
member.summary: This will never return null, it will raise an exception if unable to process the content

member.name: M:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.Misc.SelectorBreaker.QuotedSelectorProcessor.Process(System.Char)
member.summary: This will never return null, it will raise an exception if unable to process the content

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.Misc.SelectorBreaker.SelectorProcessorResult.NextProcessor
member.summary: This will never be null

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.StylePropertyName.Value
member.summary: This will never be null or blank, its value will always be trimmed

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.StylePropertyName.SourceLineIndex
member.summary: This will always be zero or greater

member.name: T:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.LessCssHierarchicalParser
member.summary: This will take the data returned from the CSSParser.Parser methods and process it further into a hierarchical set of ICSSFragment instances where each fragment is a selector (which may represent a css selector - eg. "div.Header" - or media query) or style property names and values within the selectors. Selectors may be nested in the case of selectors within media queries or selectors nested within other selectors (as enabled by LESS CSS).

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.StylePropertyValue.Property
member.summary: This will never be null

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.StylePropertyValue.ValueSegments
member.summary: This will never be null empty or contain any null or blank values, all of the strings will have been trimmed

member.name: P:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.StylePropertyValue.SourceLineIndex
member.summary: This will always be zero or greater

member.name: T:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.MediaQuery
member.summary: This ContainerFragment represent a Media Query, its Selectors SelectorSet should only have a single value (unlike the Selector class which may have multiple Selectors - eg. "div#Header h2, div#Footer"). LESS CSS supports Media Queries that wrap styles and/or other selectors whilst regular CSS only supports the wrapping of selectors in Media Queries.

member.name: T:CSSParser.ExtendedLESSParser.ContentSections.Selector
member.summary: This is a CSS fragment that represents a selector string, it may be multiple comma-separated selectors (if so, then the Selectors property will have multiple entries)
